title: Simple Nested Abstractions
goal: Learn to nest two abstraction levels.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Review spatial positions:

nenri = ?     gapru = ?     zunle = ?

(Answers: inside, above, left)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
jinvi x1 has opinion x2 (du'u) about x3 think/opine
tadni x1 studies x2 at institution x3 study

What Is Nesting?

Nesting means putting one abstraction inside another:

mi djuno lo du'u do klama

I know that you go. (One level)

mi djuno lo du'u do djica lo nu klama

I know that you want to go. (Two levels)

Outer and Inner Abstractions

mi jinvi lo du'u do tadni la .jbobau.

I think that you study Lojban.

  • Outer: lo du'u (the proposition that...)
  • Inner: the bridi do tadni la .jbobau.

More Examples

la .alis. djuno lo du'u mi prami ri

Alice knows that I love her.

mi krici lo du'u lo solri cu barda

I believe that the sun is big.

Key Point

Nested abstractions express complex thoughts: beliefs about facts, knowledge about desires, etc.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Two-Level Nesting

Translate:

  1. I know that you are happy.
  2. Alice thinks that Bob works.
  3. I believe that the cat is small.
Answers
  1. mi djuno lo du'u do gleki
  2. la .alis. cu jinvi lo du'u la .bob. cu gunka
  3. mi krici lo du'u lo mlatu cu cmalu

Exercise 2: With tadni

Translate:

  1. I study Lojban.
  2. Alice knows that I study.
  3. I think that studying is good.
Answers
  1. mi tadni la .jbobau.
  2. la .alis. cu djuno lo du'u mi tadni
  3. mi jinvi lo du'u lo nu tadni cu xamgu

Exercise 3: New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. I think that it's beautiful.
  2. Do you think that I'm right?
  3. Alice studies math.
Answers
  1. mi jinvi lo du'u ri melbi
  2. xu do jinvi lo du'u mi drani
  3. la .alis. cu tadni la .cmaci.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I know that you study." → mi djuno lo du'u do tadni
  2. "I think that it's good." → mi jinvi lo du'u ri xamgu
  3. "She studies Lojban." → ri tadni la .jbobau.

Summary

You learned to nest abstractions: putting one du'u or nu inside another. This expresses complex thoughts.
